projects.title: Source Code Stylometry
projects.bodyText:
- Developed a full-stack web application to recognize author by their style of coding using Flask REST API 
- Published a reseach paper in the ICMLC 2021 Conference(ISBN: 978-1-4503-8931-0), February 2021

projects.title: ANNAM Food Ordering App
projects.bodyText:
- A Food Ordering app made using **Android Studio** for **PICT** Students
 - Features: secure login, cart addition and deletion, payment gateway, review, and feedback
 - Advance features such as voice assistant,tab view and flipper images for better user experience

projects.title: InfoLens In-house Search Engine
projects.bodyText: - Web app to search queries across videos and text and implemented features like auto complete, auto correct and page ranking

projects.title: OCR for sanskrit language
projects.bodyText:
- Developed an automated OCR system for Sanskrit language and deployed it to web interface using Django
 - Compared ARU-Net and tesseract for creating bounding boxes, with IoU values of 0.96 and 0.91 respectively 
Explored models like BLSTM and AttentionLSTM, which achieved accuracy of 88.26% and 94.84% respectively,

projects.title: Meeting Room booking Web App
projects.bodyText:
- Designed a personalized meeting room website for booking rooms using HTML/CSS, PHP and MySQL
- Included dynamic features such as Registration, Login, Booking and Cancellation along with Error handling

projects.title: Kinship Detection using Deep Neural Network
projects.bodyText:
- Performed comparative analysis of three different deep neural network architectures for kinship detection
 - Architectures used - a transfer learning model based on ResNet50, ResNet50 with improved concatenation, and a combination of the previous model with multiple dense layers

projects.title: Student Helper
projects.bodyText:
- Deployed an web application for keystone and capstone projects using react and nodejs
 - Integrated platform where students can present ideas, form groups and create projects which can be tracked and graded by the professors and handed over seamlessly to other teams
